   660.13 DRAINS, RAVINES AND DITCHES.
   (a)    No person shall cover or fill drains, ravines or ditches without
having the plans and specifications approved by the Municipal Engineer and
getting the consent of Council.
   (b)    Any and all drains, ravines and ditches heretofore covered or filled,
without having such plans and specifications approved by the Municipal Engineer
and having the consent of Council, shall be removed; provided, however, that
additional tiles or culverts may be installed with the approval of the
Municipal Engineer and the consent of Council.
(Ord. 1763. Passed 6-28-55.)
   (c)    Whoever violates any of the provisions of this section is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the third degree. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02.
   660.14 SEWER OR DRAIN CONNECTIONS.
   (a)    No person shall make sewer or other drain connections into any pipe
or culvert not approved and consented to as provided in this chapter.
(Ord. 1763. Passed 6-28-55.)
   (b)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third
degree. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02.
   660.15 NOTICE TO FILL LOTS, REMOVE PUTRID SUBSTANCES.
   (a)    No person shall fail to comply with the following requirements within
the lawful time after service or publication of the notice or resolution is
made as required by law: To fill or drain any lot or land or remove all putrid
substances therefrom, or remove all obstructions from culverts, covered drains
or natural watercourses as provided in Ohio R.C. 715.47.
(Ord. 1970-70. Passed 12-8-70.)
   (b)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on
which a violation occurs or continues.
   660.16 BARRICADES AND WARNING LIGHTS; ABANDONED EXCAVATIONS.
   (a)    No person shall abandon or knowingly permit to remain on public or
private property, any excavation, well, cesspool or structure which is in the
process of construction, reconstruction, repair or alteration unless the same
is adequately protected by suitable barricades and guarded by warning devices
or lights at night so that the condition will not reasonably prove dangerous to
life or limb.
   (b)    No person shall destroy, remove, damage or extinguish any barricade
or warning light that is placed for the protection of the public so as to
prevent injury to life or limb.
   (c)    No person who is aware that he has removed or damaged any barrier,
light or other warning device, or who has extinguished any light, shall fail to
stop and immediately replace such barrier or other warning device, or relight
such light, if extinguished, or in lieu thereof to immediately notify the
Police Department that such barrier, light or other warning device has been
damaged, removed or extinguished.
(Ord. 1958-25. Passed 5-27-58.)
   (d)    Any owner or agent in control of a premises upon which a basement,
cellar, well or cistern has been abandoned due to demolition, failure to build
or any other reason shall cause the same to be filled to the ground surface
with rock, gravel, earth or other suitable material. (Ord. 1970-70. Passed 12-
8-70.)
   (e)    Whoever violates any of the provisions of this section is guilty of a
minor misdemeanor. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on
which a violation occurs or continues.
   660.17 SIDEWALK OBSTRUCTIONS; DAMAGE OR INJURY.
   (a)    No person shall place or knowingly drop upon any part of a sidewalk
or playground any tacks, bottles, wire, glass, nails or other articles which
may damage property of another or injure any person or animal traveling along
or upon such sidewalk or playground.
   (b)    No person shall walk on, or allow any animal upon, or injure or
deface in any way, any soft or newly laid sidewalk pavement.
   (c)    No person shall place, deposit or maintain any merchandise, goods,
material or equipment upon any sidewalk so as to obstruct pedestrian traffic
thereon except for such reasonable time as may be actually necessary for the
delivery or pickup of such articles. In no case shall the obstruction remain on
such sidewalk for more than one hour.
   (d)    No person shall unload upon, or transport any heavy merchandise,
goods, material or equipment over or across any sidewalk or curb without first
placing some sufficient protection over the pavement to protect against damage
or injury.
   (e)    No person shall allow any cellar or trap door, coal chute or elevator
or lift opening in any sidewalk to remain open without providing suitable
safeguards to protect and warn pedestrian traffic of the dangerous condition.
(Ord. 1970-70. Passed 12-8-70.)
   (f)    Whoever violates any of the provisions of this section is guilty of a
minor misdemeanor. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on
which a violation occurs or continues.
   660.18 FENCES.
   (a)    No person shall construct or cause to be constructed a partition
fence from barbed wire unless written consent of the adjoining owner is first
obtained. Such consent is not necessary to the use of one or two barbed wires,
provided that neither is less than forty-eight inches from the ground and is
placed on the top of a fence other than a barbed wire fence.
   (b)    No person shall construct, erect, maintain or use, for any purpose,
any fence charged with electrical current within the corporate limits unless
signs are posted upon such fence at intervals of fifty feet or less bearing the
wording "DANGER - ELECTRIC FENCE". Such wording shall be in plainly visible and
legible letters at least one inch high.
(Ord. 1958-25. Passed 5-27-58.)
   (c)    Whoever violates any of the provisions of this section is guilty of a
minor misdemeanor. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on
which a violation occurs or continues.
   660.19 LITTERING AND DEPOSIT OF GARBAGE, RUBBISH, JUNK, ETC.
   (a)   No person, regardless of intent, shall deposit litter or cause litter
to be deposited on any public property, on private property not owned by the
person, or in or on waters of the State, or Municipality, unless one of the
following applies:
      (1)   The person is directed to do so by a public official as part of a
litter collection drive;
      (2)   Except as provided in subsection (b) hereof, the person deposits
the litter in a litter receptacle in a manner that prevents its being carried
away by the elements;
      (3)   The person is issued a permit or license covering the litter
pursuant to Ohio R. C. Chapter 3734 or 6111.
   (b)   No person, without privilege to do so, shall knowingly deposit litter,
or cause it to be deposited, in a litter receptacle located on any public
property or on any private property not owned by the person, unless one of the
following applies:
      (1)   The litter was generated or located on the property on which the
litter receptacle is located.
      (2)   The person is directed to do so by a public official as part of a
litter collection drive.
      (3)   The person is directed to do so by a person whom the person
reasonably believes to have the privilege to use the litter receptacle.
      (4)   The litter consists of any of the following:
         A.   The contents of a litter bag or container of a type and size
customarily carried and used in a motor vehicle;
         B.   The contents of an ash tray of a type customarily installed or
carried and used in a motor vehicle;
         C.   Beverage containers and food sacks, wrappings and containers of a
type and in an amount that reasonably may be expected to be generated during
routine commuting or business or recreational travel by a motor vehicle;
         D.   Beverage containers, food sacks, wrappings, containers and other
materials of a type and in an amount that reasonably may be expected to be
generated during a routine day by a person and deposited in a litter receptacle
by a casual passerby.
 
   (c)   (1)   As used in subsection (b)(1) hereof, "public property" includes
any private property open to the public for the conduct of business, the
provision of a service, or upon the payment of a fee but does not include any
private property to which the public otherwise does not have a right of access.
      (2)   As used in subsection (b)(4) hereof, "casual passerby" means a
person who does not have depositing litter in a litter receptacle as the
person’s primary reason for traveling to or by the property on which the litter
receptacle is located.
   (d)   As used in this section:
      (1)   "Litter" means garbage, trash, waste, rubbish, ashes, cans,
bottles, wire, paper, cartons, boxes, automobile parts, furniture, glass or
anything else of an unsightly or unsanitary nature.
      (2)   "Deposit" means to throw, drop, discard or place.
      (3)   "Litter receptacle" means a dumpster, trash can, trash bin, garbage
can or similar container in which litter is deposited for removal.
         (ORC 3767.32)
   (e)    No person shall cause or allow litter to be collected or remain in
any place to the damage or prejudice of others or of the public, or unlawfully
obstruct, impede, divert, corrupt or render unwholesome or impure, any natural
watercourse.
   (f)    No owner or occupant of premises in the Municipality shall deposit or
allow to remain on such premises, unsightly piles of cans, debris or rubbish
which are offensive, noxious, dangerous to the public health or unsightly or
obnoxious to the general public.
   (g)    No person shall deposit rubbish, cans, debris and other unusual waste
at the old Municipal Garage and at the new Municipal Service Center. Such waste
shall be deposited only at such locations as may hereafter be designated by the
Service Director, on such days and at such times as are hereafter promulgated
and posted by the Director, and shall be deposited in the containers or trucks
provided therefor.
   (h)    No person shall remove, appropriate or otherwise take any rubbish,
debris or other material deposited on or around tree lawns for collection by
the City for recycling, except for authorized agents or employees of the
Service Department.
   (i)    Whoever violates any of the provisions of this section is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the third degree. A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which a violation occurs or continues. Punishment shall
be as provided in Section
698.02. (Ord. 1989-12. Passed 4-11-89.)
   660.20 IMPORTATION OF REFUSE.
   (a)    Council declares and determines that the dumping or burying of
garbage or refuse brought into the Municipality from outside the Municipality
is a nuisance and is inimical to the health and welfare of the inhabitants of
the Municipality.
   (b)    No person shall bring, transport or convey garbage or refuse from
outside the limits of the Municipality into the Municipality for the purpose of
dumping or burying garbage or refuse within the Municipality.
(Ord. 1958-25. Passed 5-27-58.)
   (c)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third
degree. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02.
   660.21 SPITTING.
   (a)    No person shall spit, excrete or expectorate any saliva or sputum
upon any sidewalk, or on the floor of any public conveyance, building, theater
or assembly hall, except in receptacles provided for such purpose.
(Ord. 1970-70. Passed 12-8-70.)
   (b)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02.
   660.22 MAINTENANCE OF PRIVATE ROAD.
   (a)    The owner of a private road or any portion of a private road along
which homes have been built shall maintain such road in a safe and usable
condition, free from dust, obstructions and nuisances, and it shall be unlawful
not to maintain such a road as herein stipulated. (Ord. 1754. Passed 5-10-55.)
   (b)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third
degree. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02. A separate offense shall be deemed committed each day during or on
which a violation occurs or continues.
   660.23 PARKING OF GARBAGE TRUCKS; CLEANING.
   (a)    No commercial rubbish hauler or packer operating within the City
shall allow any vehicle or other equipment used for the hauling and compacting
of trash, garbage, waste or refuse to be parked or maintained outdoors for any
period exceeding four hours, and all such commercial haulers and packers shall
at least once every twenty-four hours, steam clean, indoors, all equipment used
to collect, haul, store and compact trash, garbage, waste or refuse. (Ord.
1972-86. Passed 10-24-72.)
   (b)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third
degree. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02.
   660.24 STORAGE OF VEHICLES.
   (a)   No person shall park or store, or permit to be parked or stored,
outside of a garage or other enclosed structure, any junk motor vehicle, or
parts of motor vehicles or other scrap, junk or motor vehicle refuse, on any
property in the Municipality, unless such person is operating a junk yard or
scrap metal processing facility licensed under authority of Ohio R.C. 4737.05
to 4737.12, or under authority of the Municipality, or the person having the
right to possession of the property can establish that such motor vehicle or
parts are part of a duly authorized or permitted business operation on such
property.
   (b)   No motor vehicle not having a current annual license plate shall be
parked or stored outside of a garage or other enclosed structure on any
property in the Municipality for more than ten days.
   (c)   No person shall store or permit to be stored on any lot or premises
any dismantled or inoperative motor vehicle for more than three days, unless
the same is kept or stored in a completely enclosed building or garage on such
lot or premises.  Any such motor vehicle shall be deemed inoperative when the
lack or failure of the engine, transmission or other mechanical part results in
the vehicle being not usable for the transportation of persons.  Such period of
three days shall commence to run the next day following the service of such
notice.
   (d)   The Chief of Police or Building Inspector may send notice, by
certified mail with return receipt requested and by regular mail, to the person
having the right to the possession of the property on which a motor vehicle or
parts prohibited by this section are left, that within five days of receipt of
the notice such motor vehicle or parts shall either be covered by being housed
in a garage or other enclosed structure or shall be permanently removed from
the property.
   No person shall willfully leave such a motor vehicle or parts uncovered in
the open for more than five days after receipt of a notice as provided in this
section.  The fact that such motor vehicle or parts are so left is prima-facie
evidence of willful failure to comply with the notice and a separate offense
shall be deemed committed each subsequent period of five days that such motor
vehicle or parts continue to be so left.
(Ord. 2010-39.  Passed 11-9-10.)
   (e)    As used in this section, "junk motor vehicle" means any motor vehicle
meeting the requirements of divisions (B), (C), (D) and (E) of Ohio R.C.
4513.63 that is left uncovered in the open on private property for more than
seventy-two hours with the permission of the person having the right to the
possession of the property.
   (f)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor for a
first offense, a misdemeanor of the fourth degree for a second offense and a
misdemeanor of the third degree for each subsequent offense. Punishment shall
be as provided in Section
698.02. (Ord. 2008-70.  Passed 12-9-08.)
   660.25 NONSMOKING AREAS IN PUBLIC BUILDINGS.
   (a)    As used in this section, "public buildings" means all buildings and
other enclosed structures owned by the City, including, but not limited to, the
City Hall, Recreation Building, Pool Building, Service Center, Service Annex,
Cemetery Garage, Town Hall, Historic Hall and Fire Station.
   (b)    For the purpose of separating persons who smoke from persons who do
not smoke for the comfort and health of persons not smoking, in every public
building there shall be at least one area where smoking is not permitted, which
shall be designated a nonsmoking area. The Service Director is hereby
designated as the officer who shall designate the area. A nonsmoking area may
include the entire public building or any portion thereof. Designations shall
be made by the placement of signs that are clearly visible and that state "NO
SMOKING". No person shall remove signs from areas designated as nonsmoking
areas.
   (c)    No person shall smoke in any area designated as a nonsmoking area in
accordance with subsection (b) hereof.
   (d)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02
(Ord. 1989-52. Passed 1-9-90.)
   660.26 HOURS OF COLLECTION AND TRANSPORTATION.
   (a)    No person owning or driving a vehicle hauling solid waste shall cause
the collection, transportation or transfer of such waste other than between the
hours of 6:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. on weekdays. No collection, transportation or
transfer shall occur on Saturdays after 5:00 p.m. or on Sundays. Application
for exceptions to this provision may be made to the Service Director, on a form
provided by the Director. Such exceptions shall be granted only where the
applicant is able to demonstrate circumstances of great practical difficulty in
the collection and transportation of solid waste in areas where there is heavy
daytime vehicular and pedestrian traffic and a concentration of commercial
activity.
   (b)    Whoever violates any provision of this section or participates in
such violation shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree for the
first offense and a misdemeanor of the third degree for each subsequent
offense. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02. (Ord. 1991-15. Passed 4-9-91.)
   660.27 COMMERCIAL GARBAGE PICKUP, DUMPSTERS AND RECEPTACLES.
   (a)    Any commercial property within the City shall provide an enclosure
for garbage dumpsters and receptacles so as to conceal the garbage dumpsters,
receptacles and specific area used for garbage collection. The enclosure shall
have a gate or door which shall be kept closed at all times.
   (b)    The height and type of such enclosure shall be determined by the
Architectural Review Board. If, as a result of its review and consideration,
the Architectural Review Board establishes a required height that would be in
excess of that permitted by ordinance, the applicant will not be required to
seek a variance from the Board of Zoning Appeals.
   (c)    The location of such dumpsters and receptacles shall be at a distance
which is closer to the commercial building serviced by the dumpster than to any
abutting residential dwelling.
   (d)    The hours for garbage collection from commercial property abutting
residential property shall be limited to after 8:00 a.m. and before 6:00 p.m.,
Monday through Saturday.
   (e)    Whoever violates any provision of this section or participates in
such a violation, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor of the fourth degree for the
first offense. Punishment shall be as provided in Section
698.02.
(Ord. 1992-42. Passed 10-13-92.)
   660.28 PLACEMENT OF RUBBISH FOR COLLECTION.
   (a)   Garbage or waste containers with refuse, waste, garbage, and/or
clippings shall not be placed in front of any house or other building by the
owner, agent, lessee or occupant of that house or building prior to 6:00 p.m.
on the evening immediately preceding the day scheduled for refuse collection.
   (b)   Anyone who violates this section shall be guilty of a minor
misdemeanor.
(Ord. 1999-33.  Passed 6-8-99.)
CHAPTER 661
Smoking Prohibited in City Buildings and Upon and Within City Property
661.01   Definitions.
661.02   Restrictions on smoking in public places.
661.03   Posting signs.
661.04   Enforcement.
661.05   Violations and penalties.
CROSS REFERENCES
Public assembly prohibitions - see GEN. OFF.
660.25
661.01  DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)   “Smoking” means inhaling, exhaling, burning, or carrying any lighted
cigar, cigarette, pipe, or other lighted smoking device for burning or igniting
tobacco or any other plant.  “Smoking” also means any electronic product or
device that produces vapor that delivers nicotine or any other substance to the
person inhaling from the device to assimilate smoking and that is likely to be
offered to or purchased by consumers as an electronic cigarette, electronic
cigar, electronic cigarillo or electronic pipe.  “Smoking” does not include the
burning of incense in a religious ceremony.
   (b)   “Public place” means an enclosed area in any building, or an open area
upon any property owned by the City and to which the public is invited or in
which the public is permitted and that is not a private residence.  “Public
place” does not mean sidewalks or streets within the City.
      (Ord. 2017-44.  Passed 6-13-17.)
661.02  RESTRICTIONS ON SMOKING IN PUBLIC PLACES.
   Smoking in any form is prohibited in any public place, and within any City
owned vehicle.  (Ord. 2017-44.  Passed 6-13-17.)
661.03  POSTING SIGNS.
   (a)   Signs indicating that smoking is prohibited shall be clearly,
sufficiently and conspicuously posted in sufficient size to be clearly legible
to a person of normal vision at the entrance of any public place.
   (b)   Signs indicating that smoking is prohibited shall be posted in any
public place that is a non-enclosed area of any outside of any building
reasonably throughout the area they are intended to mark at a height and
sufficient size to be clearly legible to a person of normal vision.
   (c)   Signs indicating that smoking is prohibited shall be clearly,
sufficiently and conspicuously posted in every City vehicle.
(Ord. 2017-44.  Passed 6-13-17.)
661.04  ENFORCEMENT.
   Enforcement shall be implemented by the Police Chief who shall establish a
procedure for which all complaints by citizens relating to violations of this
section may be directed or referred.  (Ord. 2017-44.  Passed 6-13-77.)
661.05  VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES.
   (a)   Any person who violates any provision of this section is guilty of a
minor misdemeanor.
   (b)   Each day on which a violation of any provision occurs is a separate
and distinct offense and shall be punishable as such.
(Ord. 2017-44.  Passed 6-13-77.)
CHAPTER 662
Abatement of Nuisances
662.01   Definition.
662.02   Authority of City officials.
662.03   Abatement of certain nuisances without declaration of Council;
   notice to owner of real estate.
662.04   Abatement of other  nuisances.
662.05   Service of notice.
662.06   Relationship to other laws.
662.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
   Billposting - see GEN. OFF.
642.25
   Noxious odors; filthy accumulations - see GEN. OFF.
660.04
 
   662.01 DEFINITION.
   In reference to buildings, structures or real estate located within the
City, a nuisance means any deterioration, lack of repair or lack of maintenance
of structural materials that is a hazard to the health, safety or welfare of
its occupants or the public or is (or, if not abated, will become) a blighted
or deteriorating factor in the neighborhood which impairs or adversely affects
the value of neighboring property.
(Ord. 1991-17. Passed 5-31-91.)
   662.02 AUTHORITY OF CITY OFFICIALS.
   Whenever there shall be done or exist within the City any act, thing, or
condition of a kind which has been or may hereafter be defined by ordinance as
a nuisance, the Service Director and the Building Commissioner are authorized
and directed to promptly cause its abatement as hereinafter provided.
(Ord. 1991-17. Passed 5-31-91.)
   662.03 ABATEMENT OF CERTAIN NUISANCES WITHOUT DECLARATION OF COUNCIL; NOTICE
TO OWNER OF REAL ESTATE.
   (a)   The Service Director or Building Commissioner, upon finding that a
nuisance exists in matters involving sidewalks, weeds, tall grass, landscaping,
or abandoned unusable personal property or other debris, may cause written
notice to be served on the owner of the real estate.  The notice shall set
forth the following items and be sent by certified mail to the tax mailing
address of the owner of the real estate or by posting the notice on the real
estate:
      (1)   The nature of the nuisance;
      (2)   The estimate of the cost of abating the same if done by the City;
      (3)   A reasonable time determined by the Service Director or Building
Commissioner within which the owner shall abate the nuisance or pay the
estimated cost to the City; and
      (4)   The statement that unless the nuisance is abated within the stated
time, it may be abated by the City and the cost of abatement assessed on the
real estate involved, and the City may prosecute the owner for failure to
comply with the notice.
   Such notice of abatement may be issued by the Service Director or Building
Commissioner or both without reporting same to Council.  After five (5) days of
mailing or positioning the notice, the City may, through its employees, or by
direct employment of labor, abate the nuisance.  If the cost is not paid within
the time fixed by the Service Director or Building Commissioner, the Service
Director or Building Commissioner shall report the fact to Council which may
assess the cost incurred by use of City employees or by direct employment on
the real estate from which the nuisance originated in the same manner as other
taxes and assessments are collected.  The remedy herein shall be in addition to
the penalty provided for in subsection (b) hereof.
   (b)   If an owner of real estate fails to abate the nuisance herein, the
owner is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.  The penalty shall be as provided in
Chapter
698.
(Ord. 2011-16.  Passed 5-10-11.)
   662.04 ABATEMENT OF OTHER NUISANCES.
   (a)    If the Service Director or Building Commissioner finds the existence
of any nuisance other than those enumerated in Section
662.03, such official shall report such facts to Council which may thereupon
declare such condition, building or structure a nuisance. The Council may
specify, upon the advice of the Service Director or Building Commissioner, what
reasonable repairs or maintenance measures are necessary to abate such
nuisance.
   (b)    Upon such finding and declaration, the Service Director or Building
Commissioner may proceed in the manner provided in Section
662.03 for the abatement of nuisances. (Ord. 1991-17. Passed 5-31-91.)
   662.05 SERVICE OF NOTICE.
   The notice may be served by delivering it personally to the owner or leaving
it at the owners usual place of business or residence, or by posting it in a
conspicuous place on the real estate, building or structure involved, or by
mailing it to the owner, or by publishing it once in a newspaper of general
circulation within the City if it cannot be served in any of the other ways
above mentioned.
(Ord. 1991-17. Passed 5-31-91.)
   662.06 RELATIONSHIP TO OTHER LAWS.
   The authority to abate nuisances granted hereby and the procedure set forth
herein shall be in addition to and shall not limit the authority to abate
nuisances granted in the Health Code or other ordinances of the City or the
laws and Constitution of Ohio.
(Ord. 1991-17. Passed 5-31-91.)
   662.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any of the provisions of this
chapter shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor and fined not more than one
hundred dollars ($100.00) for a first offense. Whoever shall be convicted of a
violation of this chapter for a second or subsequent offense within a period of
two years from the date of the next prior conviction shall be guilty of a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree and shall be fined not more than two hundred
fifty dollars ($250.00) or imprisoned for not more than thirty days, or both.
Each day of violation shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 1991-17. Passed 5-31-91.)
 
CHAPTER 663
Criminal Activity Nuisances
663.01   Purpose.
663.02   Definitions.
663.03   Action to abate nuisances; costs of enforcement.
663.04   Failure to abate nuisance activity.
663.01  PURPOSE.
   (a)   To provide for the general health and welfare of the City; and
   (b)   To prevent nuisances from negatively affecting the property values
within the residential neighborhoods of the City; and
   (c)   To provide for the continued safety of City residents who reside
within residential districts.  (Ord. 2018-6.  Passed 3-13-18.)
663.02  DEFINITIONS.
   (a)   Activities, as defined in any of the following provisions of the
City’s Codified Ordinances, occurring on or in any residential property located
within the City, and engaged in by an owner, occupant or invitee of the owner
or occupant of the property are declared to be criminal nuisance activities. 
To be a criminal nuisance activity, a criminal conviction is not necessary. 
There must, however, be probable cause to believe that the criminal activity
occurred. 
      (1)    Any animal violation under Sections
618.011 (Animals Running at Large),
618.02 (Abandoning Animals),
618.03 (Killing or Injuring Animals),
 618.04 (Poisoning Animals),
618.05 (Cruelty to Animals; Animal Care Standards),
618.051 (Cruelty to Companion Animals),
 618.13 (Nuisance Conditions/Activities Prohibited),
618.11 (Animal Bites; Quarantine and Reporting),
618.15 (Hunting Prohibited),
618.23 (Rabies Vaccination of Animals Required),
618.24 (Feeding of Wild Life and Stray Animals Prohibited), or
 618.01 (Dangerous or Vicious Dogs/Control of Dogs and Other Animals) of the
Codified Ordinances;
      (2)    Any disorderly conduct or disorderly activity violation under
Sections
 648.01 (Riot),
648.02 (Failure to Disperse),
648.04 (Disorderly Conduct),
648.07 (Misconduct at an Emergency),
 648.08 (Inducing Panic),
 648.09 (Making False Alarms),
630.04 (Minor's Curfew), or 6
48.05 (Disturbing the Peace) of the Codified Ordinances;
      (3)    Any drug abuse violation under Chapter
622 of the Codified Ordinances;
      (4)    Any gambling violation under Chapter
624 of the Codified Ordinances;
      (5)    Any health, safety or sanitation violation under Chapter
660 of the Codified Ordinances;
      (6)    Any liquor control violation under Sections
612.02 (Sales to and Use by Underage Persons; Securing Public Accommodations),
612.021 (Purchase by Minor, Misrepresentation),
612.03 (Sale to Intoxicated Persons),
612.05 (Permit Required),
612.06 (Low-alcohol Beverages; Sale to and Purchase by Underage Persons
Prohibited), or
612.09 (Hours of Sale or Consumption Generally) of the Codified Ordinances;
      (7)    Any obscenity and sex offenses violation under Sections
666.03 (Unlawful sexual conduct with a Minor),
666.04 (Sexual Imposition),
666.06 (Voyeurism),
666.07 (Public Indecency),
666.08 (Procuring),
666.09 (Soliciting),
666.091 (Loitering to Engage in Solicitation),
666.10 (Prostitution),
666.11 (Disseminating Matter Harmful to Juveniles), or
666.12 (Deception to Obtain Matter Harmful to Juveniles);
      (8)    Any family offense or offense against persons violation under
Sections
636.02 (Assault),
 636.03 (Negligent Assault),
636.04 (Aggravated Menacing),
636.041 (Menacing by Stalking),
636.05 (Menacing),
630.01 (Endangering Children),
636.06 (Unlawful Restraint),
636.08 (Coercion),
636.14  (Telecommunication Harassment),
636.13 (Misuse of 9-1-1 System),
 636.18 (Domestic Violence),
636.17 (Temporary Protection Order), or
630.03 (Contributing to the Unruliness or Delinquency of a Child) of the
Codified Ordinances;
      (9)    Any property offense under Sections
642.09 (Arson),
642.10 (Criminal Damaging or Endangering),
642.11 (Criminal Mischief),
642.12 (Criminal Trespass),
642.121 (Aggravated Trespass),
 642.06 (Injuring Vines, Bushes, Trees or Crops), or
642.25 (Posting Bills without Consent of Owner) of the Codified Ordinances;
      (10)    Any theft or fraud offense under Sections
642.02 (Theft),
642.04 (Unauthorized Use of a Vehicle),
642.31 (Insurance Fraud),
642.05 (Unauthorized Use of Property);
642.14 (Passing Bad Checks),
642.15 (Misuse of Credit Cards),
642.17 (Criminal Simulation),
642.21 (Defrauding Creditors),
642.22 (Receiving Stolen Property),
642.30 (Possession of Criminal Tools),
642.32 (Forgery of Identification Cards), or
 642.27 (Fraudulent Use of Telephone) of the Codified Ordinances;
      (11)    Any weapons and explosives violation under Sections
672.03 (Using Weapons While Intoxicated),
672.08 (Failure to Secure Dangerous Ordnance),
672.09 (Unlawful Transactions in Weapons),
672.15 (Pointing and Discharging Firearms),
672.14 (Sling Shot; Bow and Arrow; Air Rifle), or
672.16 (Dirks, Blackjacks, Stun Guns and other Weapons) of the Codified
Ordinances;
      (12)    Noise control violation under Sections
649.08 (Restriction on Use of Heavy Duty Equipment),
649.12 (Noise in Residential Districts or Affecting Residential or
Institutional Property), or
 649.20 (Playing of or Permitting Adverse Noise from Sound Amplifying Devices
Prohibited) of the Codified Ordinances;
   When four or more criminal nuisance activities, as defined in division (a),
occur on separate occasions on the same residential property within any three
hundred sixty-five (365) day period, the Mayor may declare the premises to be a
criminal nuisance property and may abate the nuisance as provided in Codified
Ordinance
663.03.  (Ord. 2018-6.  Passed 3-13-18.)
663.03  ACTION TO ABATE NUISANCES; COSTS OF ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)    Notice of Declaration of Nuisance. The Mayor, upon finding that four
(4) or more nuisance activities as defined in Section
663.02 have occurred on separate occasions within any three hundred sixty-five
(365) day period on the same residential property may cause a written notice
and order to be served on the owner of the property declaring that the property
is a nuisance property. This notice and order shall identify the nuisance
activities, and the estimated costs to abate any future nuisance activity;
shall state that the owner may avoid being charged the costs of abatement by
taking steps to prevent any further nuisance activity as set forth in division
(d) of this Section; and shall state the appeal process. The notice shall
further state that if a fifth or subsequent nuisance activity as defined in
Section
663.02 occurs later than thirteen (13) days after the date of the written
nuisance declaration notice and within twelve (12) months of the date of the
fourth or any subsequent nuisance activity, the City may abate the nuisance by
responding to the activities using administrative and law enforcement actions,
and the costs of the abatement shall be charged to the owner of the nuisance
property and may be certified as a lien on the nuisance property. Notice shall
be deemed properly delivered by delivering it personally to the owner or
leaving it at the owner's usual place of business or residence, or by mailing
it to the owner, or, if it cannot be served in any of the other ways mentioned
above, by publishing it once in a newspaper of general circulation within the
City, or by posting it in a conspicuous place on the property involved.
   (b)    Abatement. If the Mayor determines that a fifth or subsequent
nuisance activity as defined in Section
663.02 occurs later than thirteen (13) days after the date of the initial
written nuisance declaration notice and within twelve (12) months after the
date of the fourth or any subsequent nuisance activity, the City may abate the
nuisance activity by using administrative and law enforcement actions, and the
costs of the abatement shall be charged to the owner of the property and, if
not paid, may be certified by the Director of Finance to the County Auditor to
be placed on the nuisance property as a lien to be collected as other taxes and
returned to the City. The cost to abate the nuisance activity shall be
calculated as set forth in division (c). The City shall provide notice to the
owner of the nuisance property of the City's decision to charge the cost of
abatement. If the costs are not paid by the owner, the City shall notify the
owner at least thirty (30) days before the costs are certified to the County
Auditor. The notice shall contain a street address or legal description of the
property, a description of the nuisance activities and the cost to abate.
Notices shall be served as set forth in division (a) of this section. The Law
Director may take any other action necessary to collect the costs of abatement.
   (c)    Costs of Abatement. Costs of abatement shall be determined based on
the time required to respond to the nuisance activity multiplied by an hourly
rate based upon the wages and benefits of a police officer, fireman, animal
warden, building department inspector or other enforcement officer, dispatch
costs, vehicle and equipment costs, and supervisory and administrative costs.
The hourly rate may be adjusted based on the number of City employees required
to abate the nuisance.
   (d)    Nuisance Abatement Plan. The owner of a nuisance property may avoid
being charged the cost of abating future nuisances if the owner meets with the
Mayor; presents a plan to prevent further nuisance activity and that plan is
approved by the Mayor; and the owner implements the plan.
   (e)    Appeal. The owner of a nuisance property who receives a notice
declaring the owner's property to be a nuisance property, a notice charging the
cost of abating nuisance activity, or a notice that the cost of abatement shall
be certified to the County Auditor, may appeal the notice by submitting a
written request to reconsider to the Mayor within ten (10) days of the date of
the notice. If, after a decision on that request, the owner disagrees with the
decision, the owner may appeal the decision of the Mayor to the Board of
Building and Zoning Board of Appeals. An appeal to the Board of Building and
Zoning Board of Appeals shall be made within fifteen (15) days of the postmark
date of the decision from the Mayor denying the request for reconsideration.
The Board shall conduct a hearing and render a decision in accordance with City
ordinances and rules governing its conduct and procedure. An appeal to the
Board of Building and Zoning Board of Appeals shall not stay any actions by the
City to abate any subsequent nuisance activity. In an appeal to the Board of
Building and Zoning Appeals of a nuisance declaration notice, the City must
show by a preponderance of the evidence that there was probable cause to
believe that each nuisance activity stated in the notice being appealed has
occurred, and that the declaration of the property as a nuisance property is
justified. In an appeal to the Board of Building and Zoning Board of Appeals of
a notice charging the cost of abating nuisance activity, or a notice that the
cost of abatement shall be certified to the County Auditor, the City must show
by a preponderance of the evidence that the charging of abatement costs or the
certification of abatement costs is justified. The owner may prevail on appeal
of any notice if the owner demonstrates by a preponderance of the evidence
that:
      (1)    He or she was not the owner at the time of any of the nuisance
activity that is the basis of the notice; or
      (2)    He or she had knowledge of the nuisance activity, but promptly and
vigorously took all actions necessary to abate the nuisance activity including,
without limitation, compliance with the requirements of division (C) of Section
5321.17 and division (A)(9) of Section 5321.04 of the Revised Code; or
      (3)    He or she had no knowledge of the nuisance activity and could not,
with reasonable care and diligence, have known of the nuisance activity; and
upon receipt of the notice of the declaration of the property as a nuisance
property he or she promptly took all actions necessary to abate the nuisance
including, without limitation, compliance with the requirements of division (C)
of Section 5321.17 and division (A)(9) of Section 5321.04 of the Revised Code.
   (f)    Nothing in this Chapter shall limit the City to pursue other remedies
against any owner. occupant. or invitee as provided in the City's Codified
Ordinances or the laws of the State of Ohio.  (Ord. 2018-6.  Passed 3-13-18.)
663.04  FAILURE TO ABATE NUISANCE ACTIVITY.
   (a)    Whenever a property owner has been billed on three (3) or more
separate dates within a two-year time period for the cost to abate nuisance
activity under this Chapter, the Mayor shall notify the property owner that he
or she may be issued a criminal citation for a misdemeanor of the second degree
thirty (30) days after the third bill is issued.
   (b)    No property owner shall fail to abate nuisance activity within thirty
(30) days after the third bill within a two-year time period for the cost to
abate nuisance activity under this Chapter.
   (c)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of failure to abate nuisance
activity, a misdemeanor of the second degree.
(Ord. 2018-6.  Passed 3-13-18.)
